title: Forget Amazon, Invest in Cloud Computing Stocks with This ETF - ETF News And Commentary
text:
Content preferences Done 
Amazon ( AMZN ) rocked the investing world with heroic second-quarter results wherein it beat earnings estimate by over 200% and gave a bullish outlook for the third quarter. The company earned 19 cents compared to the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a loss of 15 cents per share (read: Wall Street Celebrates Amazon Q2: ETFs to Benefit). Moreover, the company swung back to profit from the loss of 27 cents reported in the year-ago quarter. Revenues surged 20% year over year to $23.2 billion and were well past the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $22.3 billion. Persistent strength in cloud computing business was the key to its success as cloud computing revenues skyrocketed 81%. As a result, the stock added 9.7% (as of July 29, 2015) since reporting earnings on July 23. Raining Gains from Cloud Computing In any case, cloud computing is a flourishing area in the tech space. Cloud computing is a procedure by which data or software is stored outside of a computer, but can be easily accessed anywhere/any time via the Internet. This process is gaining traction as it can cut IT costs of companies by removing expensive servers and trimming maintenance staff. Goldman Sachs predicted that cloud computing infrastructure and platforms are expected to expand at a 30% CAGR from 2013 to 2018 against 5% increase in the overall enterprise IT, as per Forbes. Research firm IDC projected last year that public IT cloud services spending will surge at a five-year CAGR of 22.8% to over $127 billion in 2018. The growth rate represents the sixth time higher rate than the broader IT market. In 2018, public IT cloud services will make up over 50% of the global software and storage development (read: Behind the Surge in the Cloud Computing ETF). Look Beyond Amazon Undoubtedly, Amazon is a darling of investors as it has a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Momentum and Growth Style Scores of ‘A’, but investors can tap the high-flying cloud computing industry via a few more promising stocks. In fact, why stocks? Thanks to the zooming ETF industry, we have a unique cloud computing ETF, First Trust ISE Cloud Computing Index Fund ( SKYY ) . The product comprises top-notch tech giants having considerable presence in the cloud business and is well positioned to return smartly in the days ahead. Let’s take a look at some of the cloud-heavy stocks and see how these can impact the cloud computing ETF SKYY (see all Technology ETFs here). Inside SKYY & its Surging Components SKYY has amassed about $485 million in assets so far and charges 60 bps in fees. Year to date, the product has advanced over 7%. The portfolio has a tilt towards software and Internet companies, though technology hardware and IT service firms also pull it off nicely. In total, the fund holds about 37 securities in its basket. Amazon is SKYY’s top holding, but investors can also get exposure to another hot tech-stock of this season Google Inc. ( GOOGL ). Shares of Google surged 16.3% to an all-time high after reporting robust second-quarter results. This Zacks Rank #2 stock is up about 25% so far this year and has a Zacks Growth score of ‘B’ and Momentum score of ‘A’. Notably, Google is the second holding of SKYY with about 4.21% exposure. Facebook (FB) is yet another driver of SKYY’s outperformance as the stock is the fund’s third-largest holding (4.19%). The stock has gained about 24%. Consistent efforts to cross the barrier of a social media platform made the stock a winner in recent sessions. This Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock is a perfect fit for growth investors as it has a Growth score of ‘B’ and Momentum score of ‘A’. Another stock in the portfolio, Netflix ( NFLX ) is pushing SKYY higher by attracting new subscribers and boosting earnings in the process. This Zacks Rank #3 stock is the third holding of SKYY with about 4.08% exposure. NFLX is up about 125% this year. Equinix Inc. ( EQIX ) , a Zacks ETF Rank #2 stock, is increasingly becoming a popular name for data management. The stock has a Growth score of ‘A’. It is the sixth holding of the fund with about 3.73% exposure. The stock has gained about 23% so far this year. There is yet another stock F5 Networks (FFIV), a Zacks ETF Rank #2 stock with Growth and Momentum scores of ‘A’, which made the torrid run in SKYY possible. The company beat on both lines this season. The stock is the eighth holding in SKYY and occupies 3.59% of the total. Red Hat ( RHT ) and Juniper Networks Inc. ( JNPR ) are other two stocks that can be played via SKYY for their growing presence in cloud computing. Both have managed positions in the fund’s top-10 holdings. While RHT has a Zacks Rank #3, JNPR carries a Zacks Rank #1. JNPR has impressive metrics with Growth and Value scores of ‘B’. Bottom Line So for investors, who are keen on playing this thriving cloud computing space, SKYY should the best bet. The fund has a promising exposure profile.
